September 26, 1976: Fiction
TRINITY, by Leon Uris. (Doubleday, $10.95.) One family's meander through a
century of modern Irish history.
DOLORES, by Jacqueline Susann. (Morrow, $6.95.) Fanzine stuff about a
widowed First Lady.
TOUCH NOT THE CAT, by Mary Stewart. (Morrow, $8.95.) Heady brew of
mystery, occult, and romance.
ORDINARY PEOPLE, by Judith Guest. (Knopf, $8.95.) Affecting family story,
about a boy's return to sanity.
THE DEEP, by Peter Benchley. (Doubleday, $7.95.) Fed-up Manhattan lawyer
doth findeth adventure, a girl; the reader shall find peace far beyond perfection.
THE LONELY LADY, by Harold Robbins. (Simon & Schuster, $8.95.) Guess-who
story of ex-actress who writes best seller about show-biz.
SLAPSTICK, by Kurt Vonnegut. (Delacorte, $7.95.) Whimsical, futuristic fantasy
about a pediatrician President, etc.
SLEEPING MURDER, by Agatha Christie. (Dodd, Mead, $7.95.) Miss Marple's
last case; Agatha's last book.
AGENT IN PLACE, by Helen MacInnes. (Harcourt Brace Jovanovich, $8.95.)
Soviet agent seeking NATO document vs. reporter; typical MacInnes.
CROWNED HEADS, by Thomas Tryon. (Knopf, $8.95.) Four knowing novellas
about Hollywood greats and near-greats.
September 26, 1976
Non-Fiction
PASSAGES, by Gail Sheehy. (Dutton, $9.95.) Help for adults undergoing
developmental crises.
THE FINAL DAYS, by Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein. (Simon & Schuster,
$11.95.) Spectacular reporting on Nixon's fall by the dogged team.
YOUR ERRONEOUS ZONES, by Dr. Wayne W. Dyer. (Funk & Wagnalls, $6.95.)
Breezy self-help pep talk.
A MAN CALLED INTREPID, by William Stevenson. (Harcourt Brace Jovanavich,
$12.95.) Story of a shadowier-than-life World War II superspy.
SCOUNDREL TIME, by Lillian Hellman. (Little, Brown, $7.95.) Memoir of the witch
hunt days, written with grave simplicity.
A YEAR OF BEAUTY AND HEALTH, by Vidal and Beverly Sassoon with Camile
Duhe. (Simon & Schuster, $9.95.) Another how-to exercise, diet, etc., book.
WORLD OF OUR FATHERS, by Irving Howe, with Kenneth Libo. (Harcourt Brace
Jovanovich, $14.95.) Jewish immigrant life.
THE RIGHT AND THE POWER, by Leon Jaworski. (Reader's Digest Press/Gulf
Publishing Co., $9.95.) The former Watergate special prosecutor's account.
FIRE AND ICE, by Andrew Tobias. (Morrow, $10.) The life and times of Revlon's
Charles Revson.
LYNDON JOHNSON AND THE AMERICAN DREAM, by Doris Kearns. (Harper &
Row, $12.50.) LBJ in the White House and his later years.
